title: What are the dangers of exploring the supernatural without true principles? A review of E. De Martino's "Il Mondo Magico."
first_phrase: This text deals with the topic of instinctive automatism and control of the mind. The author recounts a personal experience from a night during a war where they were able to maintain clarity and control, contrasting it with those who succumbed to trance and hallucinations. The author questions whether this experience was what the ancient Greek gods felt like and reflects on the limitations of language to convey such experiences. The final 200 tokens discuss the dangers of exploring the supernatural without a proper foundation and reference the book "Il Mulo Magico" by E. De Martino. The book is said to contain interesting viewpoints and the author explores it from an esoteric perspective.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while it may be tempting for researchers to delve into the realm of the supernatural without a genuine guiding principle, it is crucial to approach the subject with caution and discipline. The work of E. De Martino, an ethnologist who explored the world of magic, is a poignant example of the dangers of failing to properly contextualize esoteric phenomena within their cultural and historical context.
